{"step_by_step_thinking": "Breastfeeding has been shown in some studies to potentially confer protection against type I diabetes. This is thought to be due to the presence of certain proteins in breast milk that may help to regulate the immune system and prevent the autoimmune response that leads to type I diabetes. However, it's important to note that this is not a guaranteed protection and other factors such as genetics and environmental triggers also play a significant role in the development of type I diabetes.", "answer_choice": "A"}
